Introduction

This first post covers setting up the local development environmentâ€”a small but necessary step to begin engaging with the lecture materials.

Setting Up the Local Dev Environment

è®¾ç½®æœ¬åœ°å¼€å‘ç¯å¢ƒ

Prerequisites

Make sure you have Git, Python 3.11, and Node.js installed on your system. Youâ€™ll also need uv, a fast Python package manager.

å‰ææ¡ä»¶

ç¡®ä¿ä½ çš„ç³»ç»Ÿä¸Šå·²å®‰è£…Gitã€Python 3.11å’ŒNode.jsã€‚ä½ è¿˜éœ€è¦uvï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªå¿«é€Ÿçš„PythonåŒ…ç®¡ç†å™¨ã€‚

Step 1: Clone the CS336 Repository

git clone https://github.com/stanford-cs336/spring2025-lectures
cd spring2025-lectures

æ­¥éª¤1ï¼šClone the CS336 Repository

git clone https://github.com/stanford-cs336/spring2025-lectures
cd spring2025-lectures

Step 2: Set Up Python Virtual Environment with UV

Install uv (if not already installed):

curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

Create a virtual environment using Python 3.11:

uv venv --python=3.11

Activate the environment:

# macOS/Linux
source .venv/bin/activate

æ­¥éª¤2ï¼šä½¿ç”¨UVè®¾ç½®Pythonè™šæ‹Ÿç¯å¢ƒ

å®‰è£…uvï¼ˆå¦‚æœå°šæœªå®‰è£…ï¼‰ï¼š

curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

ä½¿ç”¨Python 3.11åˆ›å»ºè™šæ‹Ÿç¯å¢ƒï¼š

uv venv --python=3.11

æ¿€æ´»ç¯å¢ƒï¼š

# macOS/Linux
source .venv/bin/activate

Step 3: Install Python Dependencies

ğŸ’¡ Note: Iâ€™m using a MacBook Pro (M4). The triton package doesnâ€™t support Apple Silicon, so I excluded it during the initial setup. More info: Triton GitHub

grep -v "triton" requirements.txt > requirements_no_triton.txt
uv pip install -r requirements_no_triton.txt

æ­¥éª¤3ï¼šå®‰è£…Pythonç›¸å…³åº“

ğŸ’¡ æ³¨æ„ï¼šæˆ‘ä½¿ç”¨çš„æ˜¯MacBook Pro (M4)ã€‚tritonåŒ…ä¸æ”¯æŒApple Siliconï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘åœ¨åˆå§‹è®¾ç½®æ—¶å°†å…¶æ’é™¤ã€‚ æ›´å¤šä¿¡æ¯ï¼šTriton GitHub

grep -v "triton" requirements.txt > requirements_no_triton.txt
uv pip install -r requirements_no_triton.txt

Step 4: Generate Executable Lecture Content

Compile a lecture:

python execute.py -m lecture_01

This will generate a trace file at:

var/traces/lecture_01.json

æ­¥éª¤4ï¼šç”Ÿæˆå¯æ‰§è¡Œçš„è¯¾ç¨‹å†…å®¹

ç¼–è¯‘è¯¾ç¨‹ï¼š

python execute.py -m lecture_01

è¿™å°†åœ¨æœ¬åœ°ä»¥ä¸‹ä½ç½®ç”Ÿæˆä¸€ä¸ªè¿½è¸ªæ–‡ä»¶ï¼š

var/traces/lecture_01.json

Step 5: Build the Local React Web App to View Lectures

Install Node.js if needed:

brew install node

Then build and serve the trace viewer:

cd trace-viewer
npm install
npm run dev

Open the viewer in your browser:

http://localhost:<PORT>?trace=var/traces/lecture_01.json

It should be something like .
